newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus central bank to auction bonds worth 23 mln.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus central bank to auction bonds worth 23 mln.

text.p: The Cyprus central bank on Monday started accepting bids for a five-year government bond issue due on Wednesday worth up to 23 million pounds ($44.5 million).
Bids, which can be competitive or non competitive, can be made to the central bank from Monday until Wednesday, June 11 at 0900 a.m. local (0600 GMT).

Competitive bids are those at which the bidder states the price at which they are prepared to buy the bonds, and will be accepted in part or in whole only if the bid is higher or equal to that set for the specific issue by the central bank.
Non-competitive bids are those at which the bidder will pay the average price of all competitive bids accepted by the central bank. The bonds are priced at par.
The bonds, which will be listed on the Cyprus Stock Exchange, have a coupon of seven percent payable half-yearly. It is the second bond issue this year.
